question: 2 (f)
sols_html:
Horizontal tangent lines occur when the derivative equals zero. The derivative of y is

\(y' = \frac{1}{2\sqrt{x}}\)

However, this derivative is never zero, because for all positive values of x (the domain of the derivative), \(y'\) will be a positive number, not zero.

Thus \(y = \sqrt{x}\) has no horizontal tangent lines, so the statement is true.
